Application Related.description: Strict Mode allows you to place a program, or a function, in a "strict" operating context. This strict context prevents certain actions from being taken and throws more exceptions.
Application Related.title: Use Strict

Web Security.description: Content Security Policy (CSP), a mechanism web applications can use to mitigate a broad class of content injection vulnerabilities, such as cross-site scripting (XSS). CSP Header was not found.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - Content-Security-Policy (CSP)

Web Security.description: X-Frame-Options (XFO) header provides protection against Clickjacking attacks.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - X-Frame-Options (XFO)

Web Security.description: Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header enforces secure (HTTP over SSL/TLS) connections to the server.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS)

Web Security.description: Public-Key-Pins (HPKP) ensures that certificate is Pinned.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - Public-Key-Pins (HPKP)

Web Security.description: X-XSS-Protection header set to 1 enables the Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter built into most recent web browsers.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - X-XSS-Protection:1

Web Security.description: X-Content-Type-Options header prevents Internet Explorer and Google Chrome from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - X-Content-Type-Options

Web Security.description: X-Download-Options header set to noopen prevents IE users from directly opening and executing downloads in your site's context.
Web Security.title: Missing Security Header - X-Download-Options: noopen

Web Security.description: JavaScript can access Cookies if they are not marked httpOnly.
Web Security.title: Missing 'httpOnly' in Cookie

Web Security.description: Remove the X-Powered-By header to prevent information gathering.
Web Security.title: Information Disclosure - X-Powered-By
